fernebon.b2d.util.prehensile

Class FootJumpStandard

  • java.lang.Object
    • fernebon.b2d.util.prehensile.FootJumpStandard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Prehensile

    public class FootJumpStandard
extends java.lang.Object
implements Prehensile
    This object doesn't provide logic as to whether the character should jump, nor actually make it jump - it just stores the data for Effects to decide whether to jump. The idea is that a FootJumpStandard object is attached as the user data of a sensor fixture that is used as a character's foot. PrehensileCollisionManager then notifies the foot of collisions of the sensor fixture with others, so that the FootJumpStandard object knows if it is colliding with something. isStanding is used to tell whether the character is standing on something (or rather, whether the foot is touching something.) timeSinceLastJump is used so that there is a jump delay, e.g. to stop super jumps if don't leave the ground between ticks. boostJump is used so that jumps when moving down (landing after a fall) don't cause a decrease in speed by applying an impulse in the opposite direction from motion. - If you want to jump (enough time passed, standing, etc.) but are moving down, set boostJump to true. - Then, when no longer standing, if boostJump is true, make a jump to top-up the impulse from the collision if necessary. - Always set boostJump to false after any jump, so that there aren't any weird extra jumps. PrehensileCollisionManager should update isStanding, you should manually (as in you call the relevant methods when necessary) update timeSinceLastJump and boostJump.
